reference.shortdesc: A numeric character reference is a common markup construction that is used in markup languages such as HTML, SGML, and XML. It consists of a short sequence of characters that represents a single character.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The content of the numcharref element should be the numeric value without any leading or trailing characters, for example, 10 or x0a.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: The contents of the numcharref element is typically rendered with a leading ampersand (&) and a trailing semi-colon (;).

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The numcharref element is specialized from markupname; the numcharref element is defined in the XML-mention domain module. The markupname element is specialized from keyword, and the markupname element is defined in the markup-name domain module.

example.codeblock: Numeric character references represent characters from the Universal Character Set (UCS) of Unicode. They are used to reference characters that cannot easily be directly encoded in a document, such as a copyright symbol.
